an6.19:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika in the brick house.
an6.19:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an6.19:4.6: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of death is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial. It culminates in the deathless and ends with the deathless.
an6.19:4.7: But do you develop mindfulness of death?”
an6.19:5.1: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha:
an6.19:5.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an6.19:5.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for another day and night, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an6.19:5.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:6.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an6.19:6.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:6.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an6.19:6.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live for another day, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an6.19:6.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.
an6.19:7.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an6.19:7.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:7.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an6.19:7.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to eat a meal of alms-food, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an6.19:7.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.
an6.19:8.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an6.19:8.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:8.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an6.19:8.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an6.19:8.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:9.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an6.19:9.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:9.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an6.19:9.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an6.19:9.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:10.1: Another mendicant said to the Buddha:
an6.19:10.2: “Sir, I too develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:10.3: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”
an6.19:10.5: ‘Oh, if I’d only live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out, I’d focus on the Buddha’s instructions and I could really achieve a lot.’
an6.19:10.6: That’s how I develop mindfulness of death.”
an6.19:11.1: When this was said, the Buddha said to those mendicants:
an6.19:11.2: “The mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing
an6.19:11.3: to live for a day and night …
an6.19:12.2: or to live for a day …
an6.19:13.2: or to live as long as it takes to eat a meal of alms-food …
an6.19:14.2: or to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls …
an6.19:15.1: These are called mendicants who live negligently. They slackly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.
an6.19:16.1: But the mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing
an6.19:16.2: to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful …
an6.19:17.2: or to live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out …
an6.19:18.1: These are called mendicants who live diligently. They keenly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.
an6.19:19.1: So you should train like this:
an6.19:19.2: ‘We will live diligently. We will keenly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.’
